children.text: The load from the roof frame has not been properly transferred through to the walls to the slab via load or girder studs.
The relevant Australian Standard, AS 1684 Residential Timber-Framed Construction, clause 6.3.4 Top Plates, that ‘
Girder trusses 3000mm or more in length shall be supported directly by jamb studs, concentration of load studs or posts’.
Additional girder studs must be installed to properly transfer the roof load through to the slab.
